intro: Koanophyllon tinctorium, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its striking blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Koanophyllon tinctorium is also noted for its historical use in traditional medicine and dye production.
